comment.body:
At this site: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/210659 , somehow this rule

```adblock
/^https?:\/\/(?:www\.|[a-z0-9]{7,10}\.)?[a-z0-9-]{5,}\.com\/\/?(?:[a-z0-9]{2}\/){2,3}[a-f0-9]{32}\.js/$script,xmlhttprequest,third-party
```

doesn't work to match

```
https://inactionaccompanyingstress.com/95/af/b3/95afb34ff0760b927c177d8270bde915.js
```

on my side (Firefox) although it should match via regex101. If I change

```
\.com\/\/?(?:[a-z0-9]{2}
```

to 

```
\.com\/(?:[a-z0-9]{2}
```

it works for me. Can anyone reproduce?

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/210131#issuecomment-3125875300
>Seeing it only on AdGuard for Android. Not reproduced with the same filters on ADG Windows. No issue with AdGuard certificate.

It's caused by this rule:
```adblock
@@||sdk.privacy-center.org^$script,third-party
```
from custom filter list `Bypass Paywalls Clean filter` (`https://gitflic.ru/project/magnolia1234/bypass-paywalls-clean-filters/blob/raw?file=bpc-paywall-filter.txt`) and the same happens with AdGuard for Windows on my end.
This rule unblocks cookie notice script.

Please add to user rules:
```adblock
@@||sdk.privacy-center.org^$script,third-party,badfilter
```
After that clearing website's cache might be required.

Unfortunately, I cannot reproduce it.
Please try to disable then enable content blockers in Safari settings (System settings -> Apps -> Safari -> Extensions), restart Safari and check for filters update. Do not close AdGuard app for 30-60 seconds (until update process will be finished).

If issue still continues, then please contact technical support - https://adguard.com/support.html

comment.body:
>But is it possible for the badrule user rule to be domain specific? I mean for this flightradar24.com site only? If yes then what should be the rule? Or is it not possible?

Rather not possible, but you can use a rule with `$important` modifier instead.
For example:
```adblock
||sdk.privacy-center.org^$important,domain=flightradar24.com
```
This rule should has higher priority than exception, so cookie notice should be blocked.

pull_request.title: Bump lint-staged from 16.1.2 to 16.1.4
pull_request.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 16.1.2 to 16.1.4.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v16.1.4

Patch Changes

  • #1604 90b37b0 Thanks @​iiroj! - Add another types field to package.json to make even more sure NPM detects that lint-staged includes built-in TypeScript type definitions.

v16.1.3

Patch Changes

  • #1602 7ea700b Thanks @​dword-design! - Add the types field to package.json to make sure NPM detects lint-staged includes built-in TypeScript type definitions.
Changelog

Sourced from lint-staged's changelog.

16.1.4

Patch Changes

  • #1604 90b37b0 Thanks @​iiroj! - Add another types field to package.json to make even more sure NPM detects that lint-staged includes built-in TypeScript type definitions.

16.1.3

Patch Changes

  • #1602 7ea700b Thanks @​dword-design! - Add the types field to package.json to make sure NPM detects lint-staged includes built-in TypeScript type definitions.
Commits
  • 9151254 chore(changeset): release
  • 90b37b0 fix: add root-level "types" field to package.json
  • 795be13 chore(changeset): release
  • 4463089 build(deps): update dependencies
  • 7ea700b fix: allow npm to detect built-in TypeScript type definitions
  • 0a0a701 test: make sure "git amend" works as expected
  • bfb71eb perf: combine git ls-files calls into single process (#1587)
  • f549d8a docs: replace execa link with nano-span link
  • bd5b9f6 perf(config): optimize config discovery with pathspecs
  • 020a246 docs: fix typo in CHANGELOG.md
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=lint-staged&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=16.1.2&new-version=16.1.4)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

issue.title: Give users more control over the google search ai overview
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

I deeply appreciate the effort you put into blocking the AI overview in google search. However, simply put it within the other annoyances filter seems a bit too straight forward. After all, I don't think this is as "bad" or "annoying" as the popups for website logins.


### Proposed solution

Would it be possible to provide a better control of this that allows the user to just turn this on/off without sacrificing all other cool blocks within the other annoyances filter?

Thanks!


### Additional information

_No response_

pull_request.title: Bump lint-staged from 16.1.2 to 16.1.4
pull_request.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 16.1.2 to 16.1.4.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v16.1.4

Patch Changes

  • #1604 90b37b0 Thanks @​iiroj! - Add another types field to package.json to make even more sure NPM detects that lint-staged includes built-in TypeScript type definitions.

v16.1.3

Patch Changes

  • #1602 7ea700b Thanks @​dword-design! - Add the types field to package.json to make sure NPM detects lint-staged includes built-in TypeScript type definitions.
Changelog

Sourced from lint-staged's changelog.

16.1.4

Patch Changes

  • #1604 90b37b0 Thanks @​iiroj! - Add another types field to package.json to make even more sure NPM detects that lint-staged includes built-in TypeScript type definitions.

16.1.3

Patch Changes

  • #1602 7ea700b Thanks @​dword-design! - Add the types field to package.json to make sure NPM detects lint-staged includes built-in TypeScript type definitions.
Commits
  • 9151254 chore(changeset): release
  • 90b37b0 fix: add root-level "types" field to package.json
  • 795be13 chore(changeset): release
  • 4463089 build(deps): update dependencies
  • 7ea700b fix: allow npm to detect built-in TypeScript type definitions
  • 0a0a701 test: make sure "git amend" works as expected
  • bfb71eb perf: combine git ls-files calls into single process (#1587)
  • f549d8a docs: replace execa link with nano-span link
  • bd5b9f6 perf(config): optimize config discovery with pathspecs
  • 020a246 docs: fix typo in CHANGELOG.md
  • See full diff in compare view

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.title: Give users more control over the google search ai overview
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

I deeply appreciate the effort you put into blocking the AI overview in google search. However, simply put it within the other annoyances filter seems a bit too straight forward. After all, I don't think this is as "bad" or "annoying" as the popups for website logins.


### Proposed solution

Would it be possible to provide a better control of this that allows the user to just turn this on/off without sacrificing all other cool blocks within the other annoyances filter?

Thanks!


### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body: The point will be that it is irritating to only some people.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.title: Give users more control over the google search ai overview
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

I deeply appreciate the effort you put into blocking the AI overview in google search. However, simply put it within the other annoyances filter seems a bit too straight forward. After all, I don't think this is as "bad" or "annoying" as the popups for website logins.


### Proposed solution

Would it be possible to provide a better control of this that allows the user to just turn this on/off without sacrificing all other cool blocks within the other annoyances filter?

Thanks!


### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body: I still think it should be in a separate `AI annoyance` category. Here for example, the Brave search engine also has AI answer/AI overview of their own which is also enabled by default. It's not blocked by AdGuard and shouldn't be IMO because many users might find it useful similar to Google AI Overview.

issue.title: paramountplus.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://paramountplus.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fparamountplus.com)
### Comment
> No way to submit ticket without pictures and the issue only happens on roku, which I didn't take pictures of, but after much troubleshooting i've narrowed it down to this dns blocking content on the paramount plus app via roku. Plays content immediately when changing wifi to my phone hot spot or changing this dns on my router, but they have changed something on their side that this dns blocks and it is preventing content from loading. It's some kind of ad that plays before their content, even with paid subscriptions. Please look into this so I can keep using this dns. This issue is also all over reddit, but not necessarily with your DNS. I also tried numerous other dns options that block ads and none allowed this content to play. Thanks!

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://paramountplus.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fparamountplus.com)
### Comment
> No way to submit ticket without pictures and the issue only happens on roku, which I didn't take pictures of, but after much troubleshooting i've narrowed it down to this dns blocking content on the paramount plus app via roku. Plays content immediately when changing wifi to my phone hot spot or changing this dns on my router, but they have changed something on their side that this dns blocks and it is preventing content from loading. It's some kind of ad that plays before their content, even with paid subscriptions. Please look into this so I can keep using this dns. This issue is also all over reddit, but not necessarily with your DNS. I also tried numerous other dns options that block ads and none allowed this content to play. Thanks!
